results.title: Kariba: power for Central Africa
results.creator_credit: Independent Television News (GB) and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: On 17 May 1960, Queen Elizabeth, the Queen mother, opened the Kariba Dam in Northern Rhodesia. The story of its construction and the difficulties which had to be overcome before the remote Kariba Gorge could become the biggest man-made lake in the world. Building a road into the Gorge; how floods disrupted progress; the power house; pouring the concrete and clearing the rising waters of timber. What the increased water supply and electric power will mean to Central Africa.

results.title: Kariba game rescue
results.brief_description: The rising waters of the Kariba Dam, largest man made lake in the world, threatened the wildlife in the area until Northern Rhodesian rescue teams put Operation Noah into practice. A typical day’s work is the capture of boatloads of game, such as antelope and zebra and their safe release on dry land.

results.title: Karen Kain: ballerina
results.creator_credit: Nielsen-Ferns, Richard Nielsen, Pat Ferns and Philip McPhedran
results.brief_description: An in-depth study of Canada’s leading ballerina, with a behind-the-scenes view of her preparation for a cross-Canada tour with the Ballets de Marseille. Filmed in France and Canada, includes several pas-de-deux with various leading dancers.

results.title: Karatedo
results.brief_description: Action demonstrations of hand to hand combat, women’s self defence, and use of weapons in Karatedo as practised in Japan. Introduced by World Union of Karatedo Organisations President Ryoichi Sasakawa. In Japanese language - no subtitles.

results.title: Kansas City
results.creator_credit: CiBy 2000, Sandcastle Productions and Robert Altman
results.brief_description: Set in 1934 at the height of the Depression, ‘Kansas City’ examines the intricate and often violent undercurrents that have governed American society, and in particular its race relations. Jennifer Jason Leigh plays Blondie, a working class telegraphist who wants to save her boyfriend Johnny (Dermot Mulroney) from the murderous plans of jazz club owner Seldom Seen (Harry Belafonte). Blondie kidnaps the rich Carolyn (Miranda Richardson), hoping that Carolyn’s politician husband will help save the unlucky Johnny. But it is election eve and in a city dominated by warring prohibition-era gangster tribes, Blondie finds that her needs are never a priority. Though Altman seamlessly weaves elements of noir, screwball comedy and the crime genre, it is his love of jazz music that informs this film. He organised some of the world’s leading contemporary jazz musicians to inhabit such roles as Lester Young and Coleman Hawkins (and young actor Albert J. Burnes plays a 14 year old Charlie Parker who is obsessed by the jazz clubs in the city). It is the dynamic score which propels the narrative of the film and Altman’s mise-en-scene is itself “scored” to the performances of the musicians. Kansas City was one of the leading jazz centres in the United States of America and this film is an homage to that history. But as always, Altman reveals both an intricate knowledge of cinema and a profound knowledge of the American history. The DVD features interviews with the director and cast as well as an interview with renowned jazz musician Joshua Redman who plays a saxophonist in the film.

results.title: Kansai: cradle of Japanese culture
results.creator_credit: Iwanami Productions and Japan. National Tourist Organisation
results.brief_description: A colorful description of the Kansai district, including the major cities, Iso, Nara, Kyoto and Wakayama. This district was the stage for the drama of Japanese history and has been and always will be the cradle of Japanese culture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Iwanami Productions and Japan. National Tourist Organisation

results.title: Kanha National Park
results.brief_description: Kanha National Park in the hills of Madhya Pradesh. The park is noted for its rare Indian swamp deer, together with spotted deer, black buck antelope, tigers, langur, and Indian bison.
